answerText: de Broglie wavelength[10] The de Broglie wavelength is equal to Planck's constant divided by this quantity.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 13 - Finals 1 | 11 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  group of researchers in Vienna discovered that this measure for a molecule of C60 is equal to about 2.5 picometers. For 10 points each: [10] Name this quantity, equal to the wavelength of a particle of matter. It is proportional to Planck's constant.
